description.narrative: The project is a $487 million investment in Jiangxi Chenming a greenfield paper facility in the Changbei economic development zone, Nanchang city, China. The facility will produce 350,000 tpy of light weight coated (LWC) paper and will be built and operated by Shandong Chenming Paper Holdings (Chenming or the sponsor), the largest Chinese-owned paper company, and Shinmoorim Paper MFG Company (Shinmoorim), South Koreas second largest coated paper producer and IFC client. The project will be implemented over an 18 month period and consist of: - installation and operation of an LWC paper machine with an annual capacity of 350,000 metric tons per annum (tpy); - a Bleached Thermo Mechanical Pulp (BTMP) plant with an annual capacity of 187,000 tpy; - a De-Inked Pulp (DIP) plant with an annual capacity of 136,000 tpy; - a co-generation power plant with a total capacity of 100 megawatts; and - ancillary infrastructure, including wastewater treatment and port installations. This purpose of this project is to support Chenmings strategy of becoming a major international paper company within the next five years and it will also facilitate Shinmoorims expansion in China. In so doing, it will bridge a market gap in the availability of LWC paper in the Asia-Pacific region, which is a limited producer and net importer of coated paper. Given that market trends indicate an increasing demand for LWC paper, local Chinese production of this light-weight paper will reduce costs for end-users, especially those in advertising and print media.

name.narrative: The project consists of a 350,000 ton LWC plant outside Nanchang city in the Nanchang Economy and Technology Development Area, in Jiangxi province. The project company was registered in Nanchang City on November 4, 2002 and will be located on a 2,000 mu (133 hectare ) site adjacent to the Chang-Jiu Express Highway on the west and the Ganjian River on the east. It has easy access to several modes of transportation with the Changbei Airport only 6 km north of the site, the Jing-Jiu railway 4 km away and the Nanchang International Container Terminal just south of the plant facility. The project is well-located in Jiangxi, which is one of the most forested regions in China, with respect to both access to raw materials and product distribution. It is close to the significant ports in Shanghai and Guangzhou for exports and is also proximate to key local markets, namely Beijing and Shanghai.
